<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/14/expanded-child-tax-credit-kicks-today?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
When the New Child Tax Credit Hits
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/14/expanded-child-tax-credit-kicks-today?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Boss baby gif where he slaps his mom's hand away" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/j5cTbV4Ber06X409rZ/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Boss baby gif where he slaps his mom's hand away" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/j5cTbV4Ber06X409rZ/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the biggest win for parents since the invention of the iPad, the IRS will send supersized checks for the expanded child tax credit (CTC) beginning today. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As part of the coronavirus stimulus package passed in March, the Biden administration set aside $105 billion to <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/09/how-3000-dollar-child-tax-credit-works.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hike</a> the child tax credit up to $1,600 per child. It’s one of the White House’s most ambitious economic policies. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Here’s why: </strong>The expanded child tax credit is expected to cut child poverty by <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/12/us/politics/child-tax-credit-payments.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nearly half</a>, according to a study from Columbia University. Almost 90% of the US’ 74 million children will qualify for the program.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Some details: </strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The standard credit increased to $3,600/child under 6 and $3,000/child between ages 6 and 17, compared to the existing $2,000 per child under 17. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The CTC is now fully refundable, meaning low-income families who don’t owe federal taxes can feel the credit’s full effect for the first time in recent history.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Will it stick around?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The current expansion will expire after one year, but President Biden asked for a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/28/child-tax-credit-biden-4-years-democrats-permanent.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">four-year extension</a> in his American Families Plan.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some Democrats, including senators New Jersey’s Cory Booker and Colorado's Michael Bennet, want to make it permanent, citing its profound impact on working families. “It’s the most transformative policy coming out of Washington since the days of FDR,” Booker claims. That’ll receive pushback from lawmakers who argue the program is too costly and will disincentivize parents from finding work.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What it means for business: </strong>Cowen called the expanded CTC an “<a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/the-child-tax-credit-will-boost-spending-at-walmart-amazon-wingstop-and-other-consumer-brands-11626291635?rss=1&siteid=rss" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">underappreciated stimulus</a>” that will boost sales for retailers like Walmart, Target, and Nike.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">For more: </strong>Our personal finance writer Ryan Lasker put together a cheat sheet for the child tax credit that’ll help you figure out if you qualify, how much you’re eligible for, and whether you should opt out. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/14/whats-child-tax-credit?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Read it here</a>.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/14/twitter-cancels-fleets-feature?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Not All Stories Have a Happy Ending
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/14/twitter-cancels-fleets-feature?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Tweet from Twitter about cancelling Fleets" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NzgxL2ZsZWV0c190d2VldC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Twitter</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It turns out Twitter’s Fleets feature was here for a good time, not a long time. The social media platform said yesterday it’s shutting down the Instagram Stories-esque feature that allowed users to post content that would disappear in 24 hours.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why?</strong> Eight months in, it just <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/7/14/22577166/twitter-fleets-shuts-down-stories-clone?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wasn’t that popular</a>. Twitter’s VP of product said, “In the time since we introduced Fleets to everyone, we haven’t seen an increase in the number of new people joining the conversation with Fleets like we hoped.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Moral of the story: Copying Snapchat’s ephemeral feature worked for Instagram, but platforms are learning that just because something clicks in one setting doesn’t mean it will work everywhere.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Twitter hopes other new product releases, like its Clubhouse competitor, Spaces, will be less fleeting.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/14/drug-overdose-deaths-rose-nearly-30-last-year?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Fatal Drug Overdoses Surged Along With Pandemic
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Drug overdose deaths <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-drug-overdose-deaths-soared-nearly-30-in-2020-11626271200?mod=hp_lead_pos10" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rose nearly 30%</a> nationwide in 2020 to a record of 93,331, according to preliminary federal data. The surge is pronounced on the West Coast; in San Francisco for instance, about 64% more people died of drug overdoses last year than from Covid-19.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What’s going on?</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Rates of joblessness and homelessness rose in 2020, and with them, stress and trauma. Plus, business shutdowns extended to treatment centers and other mental health resources.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>After being a scourge on the East Coast, fentanyl, an illegal drug that’s 50 times as powerful as heroin, </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/fentanyl-has-spread-west-and-overdoses-are-surging-11618484400?mod=article_inline" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spread to the West</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Plus, the best prevention for Covid-19 (isolation) was disastrous for drug users. “Isolation is also the thing that puts people at the absolute highest risk of overdose death,” Kristen Marshall, manager of the overdose prevention program DOPE Project, said to the WSJ.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>These overdose numbers reveal a rising death toll from the pandemic that extends beyond those who succumbed to the virus itself.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/14/key-performance-indicators-july-15?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/14/key-performance-indicators-july-15?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="TikTok " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMDczL3Rpa3Rvay5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>TikTok became the first non-Facebook app to hit <a href="https://sensortower.com/blog/tiktok-downloads-3-billion?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">3 billion downloads</a> globally, according to Sensor Tower. It was the most downloaded and highest grossing non-game app in the world in H1 2021.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“The medals will not be given around the neck. They will be presented to the athlete on a tray and then the athlete will take the medal him or herself.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When it seemed the Tokyo Olympics couldn’t get any weirder, IOC President Thomas Bach said hold my medal. <a href="https://apnews.com/article/euro-2020-2020-tokyo-olympics-tokyo-coronavirus-pandemic-soccer-06686aa23eccd467616a150ffd556457?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Literally</a>. Olympic winners must place the medals on themselves to preserve a contactless experience.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>How fintech is eating the world. (<a href="https://www.profgalloway.com/bank/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">No Mercy/No Malice</a>)</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENVIRONMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/14/eu-china-launch-ambitious-plans-cut-greenhouse-gas-emissions?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Climate Change’s Newest Rival: Planning
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After a smattering of announcements to cut greenhouse gas emissions over the last year, the EU and China had their “OK, y’all, I’m booking the Airbnb” moment yesterday to jumpstart action.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">In Europe: </strong>To reduce greenhouse gas emissions by 55% by 2030, the EU aims to <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/07/14/1015984262/europe-has-an-ambitious-new-climate-plan-that-imagines-a-dramatic-cut-in-emissio?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">end the sale</a> of new gas- and diesel-powered cars by 2035. The bloc also proposed taxing imports from countries with less strict climate practices.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">In China:</strong> The world’s largest carbon emitter thinks it can get to net-zero emissions by 2060. Kicking off tomorrow, 2,225 Chinese companies in the power sector will be given a <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/chinas-national-emissions-trading-set-to-begin-11626247709?mod=article_inline" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">set amount of carbon</a> they can release each year. They’ll be allowed to buy and sell the allowances like stocks or extra cucumbers from your garden.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>some of the most powerful world leaders will meet in Glasgow in November for the UN Climate Change Conference to pitch even more initiatives.</p>

<img alt="NBA 2K22 Video game cover art featuring Candace Parker" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81Nzc5L25iYV8yazIyX2NvdmVyLmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>NBA 2K</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Chicago Sky star Candace Parker will <a href="https://www.espn.com/wnba/story/_/id/31816516/chicago-sky-candace-parker-first-woman-cover-nba-2k-game?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">grace</a> the cover of a special edition of <em>NBA 2K22</em>, becoming the first woman to appear on the video game’s cover.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Parker’s appearance is meant to create <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-14/new-nba-2k-video-game-to-feature-wnba-chicago-sky-s-candace-parker?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more buzz</a> for the WNBA, now in its 25th season. Three years ago, the bestselling <em>2K </em>franchise didn’t feature any women players—now it lets users play as a woman in career mode or manage a WNBA franchise. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line, via Parker:</strong> “Being able to see women on the cover, visible in leadership positions, it helps not just in sport but also just in the boardroom, in business, or everything,” she told Bloomberg.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Three “how to”s: </strong>1) How to use a <a href="https://www.theverge.com/22573640/tiktok-video-template-how-to-beginner?mc_cid=142676b955&mc_eid=6347538c1a" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">TikTok video template</a> 2) how to <a href="https://mashable.com/article/how-to-download-podcasts?utm_source=feedly&utm_medium=webfeeds&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+Mashable+%28Mashable%29" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">download podcasts</a> and 3) how to navigate the new <a href="https://www.outsideonline.com/adventure-travel/news-analysis/national-park-reservation-systems/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">National Park reservation system</a></p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brew mini: </strong>Today’s puzzle is very special because it contains exactly 0 black squares. <h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Three Headlines and a Lie </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here are some headlines that will surely stress you out more than Kraft’s mac-and-cheese ice cream. See if you can guess which one is faker than the powder in the little blue box: </p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Muskegon County man </span><span><a href="https://www.freep.com/story/news/local/michigan/2021/07/11/muskegon-county-man-finds-158-bowling-balls-under-back-step/7905890002/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unearths</a></span><span> more than 150 bowling balls during renovations</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Apple’s weather app won’t say it’s </span><span><a href="https://www.theverge.com/tldr/2021/7/13/22575368/apple-ios-14-weather-app-69-rounding-error-15?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">69 degrees</a></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>California town </span><span><a href="https://media2.giphy.com/media/12VU2jlmrjzC6Y/giphy.gif?cid=ecf05e47f2s2wgwq2tsgs5rnzawxrll9q9s26qnby00k678r&rid=giphy.gif&ct=g" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">asks</a></span><span> residents to donate backyard pools for fish mating during drought</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2021/07/14/bolsonaro-hospitalized-hiccups/?utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=wp_world" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hospitalized</a></span><span> after 10 days of hiccups</span>
</li>
</ol>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the biggest win for parents since the invention of the iPad, the IRS will send supersized checks for the expanded child tax credit (CTC) beginning today. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs part of the coronavirus stimulus package passed in March, the Biden administration set aside $105 billion to \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/09/how-3000-dollar-child-tax-credit-works.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehike\u003c/a\u003e the child tax credit up to $1,600 per child. It’s one of the White House’s most ambitious economic policies. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHere’s why: \u003c/strong\u003eThe expanded child tax credit is expected to cut child poverty by \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/12/us/politics/child-tax-credit-payments.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enearly half\u003c/a\u003e, according to a study from Columbia University. Almost 90% of the US’ 74 million children will qualify for the program.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSome details: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe standard credit increased to $3,600/child under 6 and $3,000/child between ages 6 and 17, compared to the existing $2,000 per child under 17. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe CTC is now fully refundable, meaning low-income families who don’t owe federal taxes can feel the credit’s full effect for the first time in recent history.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWill it stick around?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe current expansion will expire after one year, but President Biden asked for a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/28/child-tax-credit-biden-4-years-democrats-permanent.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efour-year extension\u003c/a\u003e in his American Families Plan.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome Democrats, including senators New Jersey’s Cory Booker and Colorado's Michael Bennet, want to make it permanent, citing its profound impact on working families. “It’s the most transformative policy coming out of Washington since the days of FDR,” Booker claims. That’ll receive pushback from lawmakers who argue the program is too costly and will disincentivize parents from finding work.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat it means for business: \u003c/strong\u003eCowen called the expanded CTC an “\u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/the-child-tax-credit-will-boost-spending-at-walmart-amazon-wingstop-and-other-consumer-brands-11626291635?rss=1\u0026siteid=rss\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunderappreciated stimulus\u003c/a\u003e” that will boost sales for retailers like Walmart, Target, and Nike.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFor more: \u003c/strong\u003eOur personal finance writer Ryan Lasker put together a cheat sheet for the child tax credit that’ll help you figure out if you qualify, how much you’re eligible for, and whether you should opt out. \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/14/whats-child-tax-credit?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eTwitter\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt turns out Twitter’s Fleets feature was here for a good time, not a long time. The social media platform said yesterday it’s shutting down the Instagram Stories-esque feature that allowed users to post content that would disappear in 24 hours.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy?\u003c/strong\u003e Eight months in, it just \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/7/14/22577166/twitter-fleets-shuts-down-stories-clone?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewasn’t that popular\u003c/a\u003e. Twitter’s VP of product said, “In the time since we introduced Fleets to everyone, we haven’t seen an increase in the number of new people joining the conversation with Fleets like we hoped.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMoral of the story: Copying Snapchat’s ephemeral feature worked for Instagram, but platforms are learning that just because something clicks in one setting doesn’t mean it will work everywhere.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e Twitter hopes other new product releases, like its Clubhouse competitor, Spaces, will be less fleeting.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter a smattering of announcements to cut greenhouse gas emissions over the last year, the EU and China had their “OK, y’all, I’m booking the Airbnb” moment yesterday to jumpstart action.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIn Europe: \u003c/strong\u003eTo reduce greenhouse gas emissions by 55% by 2030, the EU aims to \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/07/14/1015984262/europe-has-an-ambitious-new-climate-plan-that-imagines-a-dramatic-cut-in-emissio?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eend the sale\u003c/a\u003e of new gas- and diesel-powered cars by 2035. The bloc also proposed taxing imports from countries with less strict climate practices.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIn China:\u003c/strong\u003e The world’s largest carbon emitter thinks it can get to net-zero emissions by 2060. Kicking off tomorrow, 2,225 Chinese companies in the power sector will be given a \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/chinas-national-emissions-trading-set-to-begin-11626247709?mod=article_inline\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eset amount of carbon\u003c/a\u003e they can release each year. They’ll be allowed to buy and sell the allowances like stocks or extra cucumbers from your garden.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003esome of the most powerful world leaders will meet in Glasgow in November for the UN Climate Change Conference to pitch even more
